I know there are some states that allow gays and lesbians protection from being fired for being gay, but still, there are over 30 states that say they can fire you for being gay.
 
 It's like 2004, I think these old laws need to be udated!

post_info.post_title: I Think all 50 States Should Have Anti-Discrimination Laws...

From where does the State get the authority to dictate to private organizations regarding whom they can or cannot hire or fire? If you ask me, if a business owner wants to hire only heterosexuals, it's his perogative. Further, if a gay business owner wants to hire only gay employees, that's also his choice that he should be entitled too.
 
 We need less government intrustion into our daily lives and life styles, not more.

Because I just think descrimination is just hate when you get right down to it. I don't think the government should continue to allow/foster descrimination or hate if you will. I think we've evolved enough to get past this. It just impedes progress.
 
 It's also not just private business that is doing this...it goes all the way up to the military.

title: 4Forums.com Political Debates and Polls -  I Think all 50 States Should Have Anti-Discrimination Laws...
